pull.title: doc: update labels in CONTRIBUTING.md
pull.body:
None of the examples in the "trivial" area are acceptable pull requests, unless they are acceptable in a different area (like "doc" or "log").

Fix that by removing the "trivial" area.

events.body:
Agree, 'trivial' doesn't help with categorizing at all.

ACK faf216bc713c36d7b3fac424973c8b89d235ab83

Super ACK faf216bc713c36d7b3fac424973c8b89d235ab83. I always thought this section was dumb, because it uses a different definition of "trivial" than I've ever seen before (indicating an absence of side effects, rather than simplicity).
ACK. Suggest updating the PR title to "doc: update labels in CONTRIBUTING.md"

verification.payload:
tree 3b9a4fc4d24cf895cd792e8fc0a036ca65178899
parent 5c2885f9b2e3340ef0558c9924e5386716a8d3b9
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1564404143 -0400
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1564420625 -0400

doc: update labels in CONTRIBUTING.md

events.body: Dropped the `s` again, as requested by @jonatack

ACK faa88d0b5c7f6e317d0e35daef28d320801f1bb5 - agree that trivial was pretty useless and that the meaning was unclear. Other changes look fine. Surprised the white space linter hasn't been having a field day in this file.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,19 +82,12 @@ the pull request affects. Valid areas as:
   - *Consensus* for changes to consensus critical code
   - *Docs* for changes to the documentation
   - *Qt* for changes to bitcoin-qt
+  - *Log* Changes to log messages
comments.body: Would say "Logging" or "Logs" to be consistent with "Mining" below or "Docs" above. "Log" isn't a component of bitcoin that you'd refer to with a singular noun.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,19 +82,12 @@ the pull request affects. Valid areas as:
   - *Consensus* for changes to consensus critical code
   - *Docs* for changes to the documentation
   - *Qt* for changes to bitcoin-qt
+  - *Logs* Changes to log messages
comments.body: Good addition. Not a strong opinion, but while here, perhaps shorten to log as well as docs to doc and tests to test... since they are shorter and often used in practice. For brevity, scripts and tools could be just script/tool, and utils and libraries just util/lib.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,19 +82,12 @@ the pull request affects. Valid areas as:
   - *Consensus* for changes to consensus critical code
   - *Docs* for changes to the documentation
   - *Qt* for changes to bitcoin-qt
+  - *Log* Changes to log messages
comments.body: I don't disagree, yet suggested the opposite for brevity and what is often seen in practice.

@@ -82,19 +82,12 @@ the pull request affects. Valid areas as:

   - *Mining* for changes to the mining code
   - *Net* or *P2P* for changes to the peer-to-peer network code
